resources.string: API Level 18\nThe device supports app widgets.
API Level 9\nThe audio pipeline of device is low-latency, more suitable for audio applications sensitive to delays or lag in sound input or output.
API Level 21\nThe device includes at least one form of audio output, such as speakers, audio jack or streaming over bluetooth.
API Level 20\nThe device can perform backup and restore operations on installed applications.
API Level 8\nThe device is capable of communicating with other devices via Bluetooth.
API Level 18\nThe device is capable of communicating with other devices via Bluetooth Low Energy radio.
API Level 7\nThe device has a camera facing away from the screen.
API Level 17\nThe device has at least one camera pointing in some direction.
API Level 7\nThe camera of device supports auto-focus.
API Level 21\nAt least one of the cameras on the device supports the manual post-processing capability level.
API Level 21\nAt least one of the cameras on the device supports the manual sensor capability level.
API Level 21\nAt least one of the cameras on the device supports the RAW capability level.
API Level 20\nThe device can support having an external camera connected to it. The external camera may not always be connected or available to applications to use.
API Level 7\nThe camera of device supports flash.
API Level 9\nThe device has a front facing camera.
API Level 21\nAt least one of the cameras on the device supports the full hardware capability level.
API Level 21\nThe Connection Service API is enabled on the device.
API Level 19\nThe device is capable of communicating with consumer IR devices.
API Level 19\nThe device supports device policy enforcement via device admins.

API Level 11\nThe device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events. For instance, the device might use a mouse or remote control to drive a cursor, and emulate basic touch pointer events like down, up, drag, etc. All devices that support android.hardware.touchscreen or a sub-feature are presumed to also support faketouch.

API Level 13\nThe device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events that supports distinct tracking of two or more fingers. This is an extension of FEATURE_FAKETOUCH for input devices with this capability. Note that unlike a distinct multitouch screen as defined by FEATURE_TOUCHSCREEN_MULTITOUCH_DISTINCT, these kinds of input devices will not actually provide full two-finger gestures since the input is being transformed to cursor movement on the screen. That is, single finger gestures will move a cursor; two-finger swipes will result in single-finger touch events; other two-finger gestures will result in the corresponding two-finger touch event.

API Level 13\nThe device does not have a touch screen, but does support touch emulation for basic events that supports tracking a hand of fingers (5 or more fingers) fully independently. This is an extension of FEATURE_FAKETOUCH for input devices with this capability. Note that unlike a multitouch screen as defined by FEATURE_TOUCHSCREEN_MULTITOUCH_JAZZHAND, not all two finger gestures can be detected due to the limitations described for FEATURE_FAKETOUCH_MULTITOUCH_DISTINCT.
API Level 21\nThe device has all of the inputs necessary to be considered a compatible game controller, or includes a compatible game controller in the box.
API Level 18\nThe device supports a home screen that is replaceable by third party applications.
API Level 18\nThe device supports adding new input methods implemented with the InputMethodService API.

API Level 21\nThe device supports leanback UI. This is typically used in a living room television experience, but is a software feature unlike FEATURE_TELEVISION. Devices running with this feature will use resources associated with the "television" UI mode.
API Level 21\nThe device supports live TV and can display contents from TV inputs implemented with the TvInputService API.
API Level 7\nThe device supports live wallpapers.
API Level 8\nThe device supports one or more methods of reporting current location.
API Level 8\nThe device has a Global Positioning System receiver and can report precise location.
API Level 8\nThe device can report location with coarse accuracy using a network-based geolocation system.
API Level 8\nThe device can record audio via a microphone.
API Level 21\nThe device supports creating secondary users and managed profiles via DevicePolicyManager.
API Level 9\nThe device can communicate using Near-Field Communications (NFC).
API Level 19\nThe device supports host- based NFC card emulation.
API Level 21\nThe device supports the OpenGL ES Android Extension Pack.
API Level 20\nThe device supports printing.

API Level 13\nThe device supports landscape orientation screens. For backwards compatibility, you can assume that if neither this nor FEATURE_SCREEN_PORTRAIT is set then the device supports both portrait and landscape.

API Level 13\nThe device supports portrait orientation screens. For backwards compatibility, you can assume that if neither this nor FEATURE_SCREEN_LANDSCAPE is set then the device supports both portrait and landscape.
API Level 21\nThe device supports secure removal of users. When a user is deleted the data associated with that user is securely deleted and no longer available.
API Level 8\nThe device includes an accelerometer.
API Level 21\nThe device includes an ambient temperature sensor.
API Level 9\nThe device includes a barometer (air pressure sensor).
API Level 8\nThe device includes a magnetometer (compass).
API Level 9\nThe device includes a gyroscope.
API Level 20\nThe device includes a heart rate monitor.
API Level 21\nThe heart rate sensor on this device is an Electrocargiogram.
API Level 7\nThe device includes a light sensor.
API Level 7\nThe device includes a proximity sensor.
API Level 21\nThe device includes a relative humidity sensor.
API Level 19\nThe device includes a hardware step counter.
API Level 19\nThe device includes a hardware step detector.
API Level 9\nThe SIP API is enabled on the device.
API Level 9\nThe device supports SIP-based VOIP.
API Level 7\nThe device has a telephony radio with data communication support.
API Level 7\nThe device has a CDMA telephony stack.
API Level 7\nThe device has a GSM telephony stack.

API Level 16\nThis is a device dedicated to showing UI on a television. Television here is defined to be a typical living room television experience: displayed on a big screen, where the user is sitting far away from it, and the dominant form of input will be something like a DPAD, not through touch or mouse.
API Level 8\nThe display of device has a touch screen.
API Level 7\nThe touch screen of device supports multitouch sufficient for basic two-finger gesture detection.
API Level 8\nThe touch screen of device is capable of tracking two or more fingers fully independently.
API Level 9\nThe touch screen of device is capable of tracking a full hand of fingers fully independently - that is, 5 or more simultaneous independent pointers.
API Level 12\nThe device supports connecting to USB accessories.
API Level 12\nThe device supports connecting to USB devices as the USB host.
API Level 21\nThe device supports verified boot.

API Level 20\nThis is a device dedicated to showing UI on a watch. A watch here is defined to be a device worn on the body, perhaps on the wrist. The user is very close when interacting with the device.
API Level 20\nThe device has a full implementation of the android.webkit.* APIs. Devices lacking this feature will not have a functioning WebView implementation.
API Level 8\nThe device supports WiFi (802.11) networking.
API Level 14\nThe device supports Wi-Fi Direct networking.
